chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederick W Dixon-Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees, surcharges including mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done.  Collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages. To be paid by the end of supervision.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Court found defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Earned Release Programs after serving five (5) years.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order electronically transmitted to DOC.  jm

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
Proposed Amendment to JOC and Order
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 02, Judge Childs.  jm

Defendant Frederick W Dixon-Allen in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Frederick W Dixon-Allen in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Nicole Allen     


Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 10 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 168 days served. Court ordered 6 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 4 YEARS Extended Supervision.

Court found defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs after serving 5 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
-No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-No contact with drug community.
-No contact with JABARI R-G.
-No contact with victims.
-No contact with any Toppers Pizza in Milwaukee County.
-Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
-Maintain fulltime employment and or school.
-Restitution set at 0 (zero)

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages. To be paid by the end of supervision. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Letter received from defendant, filed.

Defendant Frederick W Dixon-Allen in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Frederick W Dixon-Allen in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  

Case passed: to try to locate attorney Glenn Givens, counsel of record for defendant.
Case recalled:
Sames appearances:

Defense counsel Thomas Flanagan and the court unable to locate attorney Givens.  The Court discharges attorney Givens and allows attorney Flanagan to now represent defendant.  Attorney Flanagan has received PSI and reviewed with the defendant but still needs discovery.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary received and filed.

Defendant Frederick W Dixon-Allen in court with attorney Glenn O. Givens.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Defendant would like to enter a projected guilty plea.  Parties orally striked the "party to a crime" enhancer as charged in the information.  The Court ordered the party to a crime enhancer striked from the charge.  

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.   PSI was ordered.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Glenn O. Givens in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter in court due to Justice Point Violation.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  The Court forfeits no bail at this time.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.

Jury trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel filed.

against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by defense.  The newly assigned court is Judge Pocan's Court.

Defendant Frederick W Dixon-Allen in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Timothy Cotter for Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Amy Resnick-Fox Point Police Department Seargent. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frederick W Dixon-Allen in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Frederick W Dixon-Allen in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE. 

COURT ORDERS DNA SAMPLE TO BE OBTAINED BY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
